section_list.name: Messages for Location Information Transfer Procedures
E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by E-SMLC to initiate E-CID measurements.
Direction: E-SMLC ? eNB.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.1.1.1 - Measurement Periodicity IE - ifReportCharacteristicsPeriodic: This IE shall be present if the Report Characteristics IE is set to the value “Periodic”.

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
ENUMERATED (Cell-ID, Angle of Arrival, Timing Advance Type 1, Timing Advance Type 2, RSRP, RSRQ, …)

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by eNB to indicate that the requested E-CID measurement is successfully initiated.
Direction: eNB ? E-SMLC.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

9.2.5 E-CID Measurement Result - Section Description: The purpose of the E-CID Measurement Result information element is to provide the E-CID measurement result. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "Periodic", the eNB shall initiate the requested measurements and shall reply with the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message without including either the E-CID Measurement Result IE or the Cell Portion ID IE in this message. The eNB shall then periodically initiate the E-CID Measurement Report procedure for the measurements, with the requested reporting periodicity.
9.2.5 Serving Cell ID IE Semantics: E-UTRAN Cell Identifier of the serving cell 9.2.6 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.6 PLMN identity IE Semantics: PLMN identity - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 Serving Cell TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code of the serving cell

9.2.5 E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE Semantics: The configured estimated geographical position of the antenna of the cell. 9.2.8 E-UTRAN Access Point Position - Section Description: E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an E-UTRAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [7]. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.2.8 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.8 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.8 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.8 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude “h” expressed in metres is derived from the “uncertainty code” k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested.
9.2.5 Value Angle of Arrival IE Semantics: According to mapping in TS 36.133 [8]
9.2.5 Value Timing Advance Type 1 IE Semantics: According to mapping in TS 36.133 [8]
9.2.5 Value Timing Advance Type 2 IE Semantics: According to mapping in TS 36.133 [8]
9.2.5 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier of the reported cell
9.2.5 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL for FDD and NDL/UL for TDD in ref. TS 36.104 [5]
9.2.5 ECGI IE Semantics: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the reported cell 9.2.6 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.6 PLMN identity IE Semantics: PLMN identity - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier of the reported cell
9.2.5 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL for FDD and NDL/UL for TDD in ref. TS 36.104 [5]
9.2.5 ECGI IE Semantics: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the reported cell 9.2.6 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.6 PLMN identity IE Semantics: PLMN identity - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or E-SMLC when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. The conditions for inclusion of the LPPa Transaction ID IE are described in clause 10.

9.2.2 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.2 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.2 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.2 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.2 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

9.2.12 Cell Portion ID - Section Description: This parameter gives the current Cell Portion associated with the target UE. The Cell Portion ID is the unique identifier for a cell portion within a cell. Table 9.2.12-1: Cell Portion 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "Periodic", the eNB shall initiate the requested measurements and shall reply with the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message without including either the E-CID Measurement Result IE or the Cell Portion ID IE in this message. The eNB shall then periodically initiate the E-CID Measurement Report procedure for the measurements, with the requested reporting periodicity.

9.2.13 Inter-RAT Measurement Result - Section Description: The purpose of the Inter-RAT Measurement Result information element is to provide the Inter-RAT measurement results. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.2.13 UTRA EcNo IE Semantics: This IE applies to FDD only.

9.2.15 WLAN Measurement Result - Section Description: The WLAN Measurement Result information element provides the WLAN measurement results. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the eNB shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the E-SMLC shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the eNB. If available, the eNB shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the eNB, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.2.15 SSID IE Semantics: Includes the SSID field as defined in subclause 8.4.2.2 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.15 BSSID IE Semantics: Includes the BSSID field as defined in subclause 8.2.4.3.4 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.15 HESSID IE Semantics: Includes the HESSID field as defined in subclause 8.4.2.94 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.15 Operating Class IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN Operating Class as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.15 Country Code IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN country code as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.15 WLAN Channel IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN channel number as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.15 WLAN Band IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN band as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by eNB to indicate that the requested E-CID measurement cannot be initiated.
Direction: eNB ? E-SMLC.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.1 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.
ENUMERATED (Unspecified, Requested Item not Supported, Requested Item Temporarily not Available, ... )

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)

9.2.2 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

9.2.2 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT FAILURE INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by eNB to indicate that the previously requested E-CID measurement can no longer be reported.
Direction: eNB ? E-SMLC.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.1 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.
ENUMERATED (Unspecified, Requested Item not Supported, Requested Item Temporarily not Available, ... )

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT
aoa:
This message is sent by eNB to report the results of the requested E-CID measurement.
Direction: eNB ? E-SMLC.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

9.2.5 E-CID Measurement Result - Section Description: The purpose of the E-CID Measurement Result information element is to provide the E-CID measurement result. 8.2.3 E-CID Measurement Report 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested. If available, the eNB shall include the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE which is the configured estimated serving antenna position in the E-CID Measurement Result IE within the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message. Upon reception of this E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the geographical position of the E-UTRAN access point.
9.2.5 Serving Cell ID IE Semantics: E-UTRAN Cell Identifier of the serving cell 9.2.6 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.6 PLMN identity IE Semantics: PLMN identity - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The Selected PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 Serving Cell TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code of the serving cell

9.2.5 E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE Semantics: The configured estimated geographical position of the antenna of the cell. 9.2.8 E-UTRAN Access Point Position - Section Description: E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an E-UTRAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [7]. 8.2.3 E-CID Measurement Report 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation If available, the eNB shall include the E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE which is the configured estimated serving antenna position in the E-CID Measurement Result IE within the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message. Upon reception of this E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE, the E-SMLC may use the value as the geographical position of the E-UTRAN access point.
9.2.8 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.8 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT TERMINATION COMMAND
aoa:
This message is sent by the E-SMLC to terminate the requested E-CID measurement.
Direction: E-SMLC ? eNB.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

9.2.2 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)

9.2.2 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB or E-SMLC when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. The conditions for inclusion of the LPPa Transaction ID IE are described in clause 10. 8.3.1 Error Indication 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation The ERROR INDICATION message shall contain at least either the Cause IE or the Criticality Diagnostics IE.

9.2.2 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.2 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.2 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

9.2.4 LPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The LPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same LPPa Transaction ID. The LPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The LPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.2 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.2 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

8.4.1 Assistance Information Control 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Broadcast IE is included in the ASSISTANCE INFORMATION CONTROL message and set to "start", the eNB may start broadcasting the assistance information. If the Broadcast IE is included in the ASSISTANCE INFORMATION CONTROL message and set to "stop", the eNB may stop broadcasting the assistance information. 8.4.1 Assistance Information Control 8.4.1.3 Abnormal Conditions If the Broadcast IE is included in the ASSISTANCE INFORMATION CONTROL message and set to "start", and no assistance information is available, the eNB shall consider the procedure as failed. If neither the Assistance Information IE nor the Broadcast IE are included in the ASSISTANCE INFORMATION CONTROL message, the eNB shall consider the procedure as failed.

It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [7].
9.2.8 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.8 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.8 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.8 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude “h” expressed in metres is derived from the “uncertainty code” k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

9.2.7 SFN Initialisation Time IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second.

It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [7].

9.2.8 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).

9.2.9 Two IE Semantics: If a bit is set to "0", it indicates that the PRS is muted in the corresponding PRS positioning occasion (numbering from any sub frame for which SFN=0) in a periodic cycle of length equal to the length of the bit string
9.2.9 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 thirty-two IE Semantics: Same as above

9.2.9 five-hundred-and-twelve IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 one-thousand-and-twenty-four IE Semantics: Same as above

9.2.7 CRS CP Length IE Semantics: Cyclic prefix length of the CRS.

9.2.14 CHOICE Subframe Allocation IE Semantics: Subframe allocation, ref TS 36.331 [10]

9.2.7 NPRS configuration IE Semantics: The NPRS configuration with the mapping to resource elements as specified for the Type 1 NPRS in TS 36.211 sub-clause 10.2.6A.2 [6]. Only applicable for inband mode NB-IoT operation. 9.2.16 NPRS configuration - Section Description: The NPRS Configuration IE is used to describe the configuration of NPRS for the concerned NB-IOT carrier.
9.2.16 NPRS subframe configuration Part A IE Semantics: For NPRS subframe configuration Part A and NPRS subframe configuration Part B, at least one of them must be present in NPRS configuration.
9.2.16 Ten IE Semantics: Subframes not containing NPRS are indicated with ‘0’. Subframes containing NPRS are indicated with ‘1’
9.2.16 Forty IE Semantics: Same as above

9.2.16 Ten-TDD IE Semantics: Subframes not containing NPRS are indicated with ‘0’. Subframes containing NPRS are indicated with ‘1’. The subframe #1 and #2 are not included in this Bit String. This IE applies to NB-IoT TDD only.
9.2.16 Forty-TDD IE Semantics: Same as above.
9.2.17 NPRS Muting Configuration - Section Description: The NPRS Muting Configuration IE is used to describe the configuration of NPRS muting patterns for the concerned NB-IOT carrier.

9.2.17 Two IE Semantics: Each bit in a muting pattern corresponds to: for Part A, consecutive 10 subframes, for Part B, one NPRS occasion. The first bit of the NPRS muting sequence corresponds to the first NPRS positioning occasion (for Part B) or the first NPRS subframes (for PartA) that starts from any subframe for which SFN=0. The sequence is valid for all subframes after the target device has received the nprs-MutingInfo.
9.2.17 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.17 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.17 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above

9.2.7 NPRSsequenceInfo IE Semantics: The index of the PRB containing the NPRS as defined in the table nprsSequenceInfo to EUTRA PRB index relation, refer to TS 36.355 [13]. Only included in case of inband mode NB-IoT operation.

9.2.7 NPRS Type 2 IE Semantics: The NPRS configuration with the mapping to resource elements as specified for the Type 2 NPRS in TS 36.211 sub-clause 10.2.6A.2 [6]. 9.2.16 NPRS configuration - Section Description: The NPRS Configuration IE is used to describe the configuration of NPRS for the concerned NB-IOT carrier.
9.2.16 NPRS subframe configuration Part A IE Semantics: For NPRS subframe configuration Part A and NPRS subframe configuration Part B, at least one of them must be present in NPRS configuration.
9.2.16 Ten IE Semantics: Subframes not containing NPRS are indicated with ‘0’. Subframes containing NPRS are indicated with ‘1’
9.2.16 Forty IE Semantics: Same as above

9.2.16 Ten-TDD IE Semantics: Subframes not containing NPRS are indicated with ‘0’. Subframes containing NPRS are indicated with ‘1’. The subframe #1 and #2 are not included in this Bit String. This IE applies to NB-IoT TDD only.
9.2.16 Forty-TDD IE Semantics: Same as above.
9.2.17 NPRS Muting Configuration - Section Description: The NPRS Muting Configuration IE is used to describe the configuration of NPRS muting patterns for the concerned NB-IOT carrier.

9.2.17 Two IE Semantics: Each bit in a muting pattern corresponds to: for Part A, consecutive 10 subframes, for Part B, one NPRS occasion. The first bit of the NPRS muting sequence corresponds to the first NPRS positioning occasion (for Part B) or the first NPRS subframes (for PartA) that starts from any subframe for which SFN=0. The sequence is valid for all subframes after the target device has received the nprs-MutingInfo.
9.2.17 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.17 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.17 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 NPRS subframe configuration Part B IE Semantics: For NPRS subframe configuration Part A and NPRS subframe configuration Part B, at least one of them must be present in NPRS configuration.
│     ├─Number of NPRS subframes in one occasion

9.2.16 Number of NPRS subframes in one occasion IE Semantics: Number of consecutive subframes containing NPRS in one NPRS occasion. The values sf10 and sf20 are only applicable to FDD mode. The value sf2560 is only applicable to TDD mode.
9.2.16 Periodicity of NPRS IE Semantics: Periodicity of NPRS occasion TNPRS

9.2.16 starting subframe offset of NPRS occasion IE Semantics: For a given periodicity of NPRS occasion TNPRS, the starting subframe offset of NPRS occasion = a* TNPRS. 
9.2.17 NPRS Muting Configuration - Section Description: The NPRS Muting Configuration IE is used to describe the configuration of NPRS muting patterns for the concerned NB-IOT carrier.

9.2.17 Two IE Semantics: Each bit in a muting pattern corresponds to: for Part A, consecutive 10 subframes, for Part B, one NPRS occasion. The first bit of the NPRS muting sequence corresponds to the first NPRS positioning occasion (for Part B) or the first NPRS subframes (for PartA) that starts from any subframe for which SFN=0. The sequence is valid for all subframes after the target device has received the nprs-MutingInfo.
9.2.17 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.17 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.17 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above

Configurations 0 and 6 are not applicable for NB-IoT.

section_list.name: E-UTRAN Access Point Position
aoa: E-UTRAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an E-UTRAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [7].
9.2.8 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.8 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.8 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.8 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.8 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude “h” expressed in metres is derived from the “uncertainty code” k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

section_list.name: PRS Muting Configuration
aoa: 9.2.9 CHOICE PRS Muting Configuration IE Semantics: The PRS Muting Configuration IE is used to describe the configuration of PRS muting patterns for the concerned cell/TP, according to TS 36.211 [6] and TS 36.133 [8].

9.2.9 Two IE Semantics: If a bit is set to "0", it indicates that the PRS is muted in the corresponding PRS positioning occasion (numbering from any sub frame for which SFN=0) in a periodic cycle of length equal to the length of the bit string
9.2.9 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 thirty-two IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 sixty-four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 one-hundred-and-twenty-eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 two-hundred-and-fifty-six IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 five-hundred-and-twelve IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.9 one-thousand-and-twenty-four IE Semantics: Same as above

section_list.name: Requested SRS Transmission Characteristics
aoa: The purpose of the Requested SRS Transmissions Characteristics information element is to inform the eNB of the number and bandwidth of periodic SRS transmissions requested for the UE for the purpose of UTDOA positioning.
9.2.10 Number Of Transmissions IE Semantics: The number of periodic SRS transmissions requested. The value of ‘0’ represents an infinite number of SRS transmissions.
9.2.10 Bandwidth IE Semantics: The requested bandwidth of the SRS transmissions, the value of which corresponds to the number of resource blocks requested to be allocated.

section_list.name: UL Configuration
aoa: The purpose of the Uplink Configuration information element is to inform the E-SMLC of the uplink configuration parameters.
9.2.11 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier of the PCell
9.2.11 UL EARFCN IE Semantics: The uplink E-UTRA carrier frequency of the PCell
9.2.11 TA Type1 IE Semantics: Timing advance measurement, the mapping of the reported quantity is defined in TS 36.133 [8]
9.2.11 TA Type2 IE Semantics: Timing advance measurement, the mapping of the reported quantity is defined in TS 36.133 [8]
9.2.11 Number of Transmissions IE Semantics: The number of periodic SRS transmissions. The value of ‘0’ represents an infinite number of SRS transmissions.
9.2.11 SRS Configuration IE Semantics: Configuration of SRS for corresponding serving cells.
9.2.11 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell ID.
9.2.11 UL EARFCN IE Semantics: The uplink E-UTRA carrier frequency of the corresponding serving cell. Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [5].
ENUMERATED (n6, n15, n25, n50, n75, n100)

9.2.11 UL-bandwidth IE Semantics: Cell transmission bandwidth configuration in uplink corresponding to an E-UTRA channel bandwidth TS 36.104 [5], Table 5.6-1. Value n6 corresponds to 6 resource blocks, n15 to 15 resource blocks and so on.

9.2.11 srs-Bandwidth IE Semantics: UE-specific SRS bandwidth configuration TS 36.211 [6]
9.2.11 srs-AntennaPort IE Semantics: .Number of antenna ports for SRS transmission. TS 36.211 [6]
9.2.11 srs-HoppingBandwidth IE Semantics: SRS frequency hopping bandwidth configuration TS 36.211 [6]
ENUMERATED (cs0, cs1, cs2, cs3, cs4, cs5, cs6, cs7)

9.2.11 srs-ConfigIndex IE Semantics: SRS configuration index TS 36.211 [6]

9.2.11 transmissionComb IE Semantics: Transmission comb TS 36.211 [6]
9.2.11 freqDomainPosition IE Semantics: Frequency domain position TS 36.211 [6]

9.2.11 SFN Initialisation Time IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second.
